result.execSummary:
The defendant Michelle Tennelle Singleton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to be paid by 9-1-15. If not paid in full any remaining balance shall be due immediately; failure to pay will result in and entry of civil judgment.

Release privileges for the Day Reporting Center ONLY. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. Provide a DNA sample, and pay the DNA surcharge, if not previously done, and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence, credit for 141 days (4-8-14 to 8-27-14)
Court advises the defendant may not possess a firearm.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michelle Tennelle Singleton

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Order, signed and filed. 
The defendant's motion or request for release privileges/additional release privileges is denied. 
Additional release privileges would unduly depcreciate the seriousness of the offense, render the House of Correction time meaningless, and frustrate the court's specific sentencing intent. 
Copies mailed to parties.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to Carolina Stark, Branch 17, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se request for child care and medical privileges.
Court orders document to be sealed and to remain in the Court file. Documents sealed and placed in Court file. TCT

Defendant Michelle Tennelle Singleton in court with attorney Richard J. Johnson.  Defendant Michelle Tennelle Singleton in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing proceeds.    Upon inquiry of the Court, State advises they have complied with victim notification. Statements by counsel and defendant.



COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 12 MONTHS at the House of Correction, consecutive to anyother sentence, release privileges for the Day Reporting Center ONLY.  Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. Credit for 141 days (4-8-2014 to 8-27-2014).
Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid by 9-1-2015. If not paid in full any remaining balance shall be due immediately; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 

COURT ORDERS:
Court advises the defendant may not possess a firearm; is to provide a DNA sample, and pay the DNA surcharge, if not previously done, and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  



Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement received and filed.
Sentencing hearing on August 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Richard J. Johnson in court, defendant Michelle Tennelle Singleton not in court, in custody.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2014, this case will be assigned to:  Judge STARK, Branch 17, in ROOM 313 of the Safety Building.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.
CASE FORWARDED TO BRANCH 34 FOR BRANCH 26.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Michelle Tennelle Singleton in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Michelle Tennelle Singleton in custody.  Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    
On State's motion, Court ordered COUNT 1 DISMISSED and read in.  As to COUNT 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michelle Tennelle Singleton in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Michelle Tennelle Singleton in custody.  Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michelle Tennelle Singleton in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Michelle Tennelle Singleton in custody.  Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Sidebar held.  Court allows one final adjournment.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-19-2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Richard J Johnson in court, defendant Michelle Tennelle Singleton not in court, in custody.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Patricia Daugherty.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 26.  Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order, signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michelle Tennelle Singleton in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant Michelle Tennelle Singleton in custody.  Step Nolten for Patricia I Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.

No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription and no drug paraphernalia.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Michelle Tennelle Singleton in court with attorney Mary D Scholle.  Defendant Michelle Tennelle Singleton in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
